intro: Hibbertia glomerosa, commonly known as the clustered coral-flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its striking, clustered orange-red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, leathery leaves. Its flowers are tubular and have a distinctive coral-like appearance, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Hibbertia glomerosa is often found in sandy soils in coastal and heathland environments.
